message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: import java.util.*;

public class Main {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        String str = "A=4 H=X PO=87";
        Map<String, String> map = convert(str);
        System.out.println(map.getClass().getSimpleName() + map);
    }

    public static Map<String, String> convert(String str) {
        Map<String, String> map = new HashMap<>();
        StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(str, " ");
        while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
            String[] entry = st.nextToken().split("=");
            map.put(entry[0], entry[1]);
        }
        return map;
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The convert method uses StringTokenizer to split the input string into key-value pairs. The delimiter is a space character. For each token, it splits the token into a key and a value using the equals sign as the delimiter. It then puts the key and value into a HashMap. The main method calls the convert method with a string of key-value pairs, and then prints the class name of the map and the map itself.
